coded_answer.p: I have recievedreceivedreceived your letter this morning. I am sorry to hear that Richard is ill and is unable to attemptattend the conference; I am glad that you are able to be the leader of the group. I hope that thesethe informationsinformation below areis very useful to you, during your attemptattendance ofat the conference.

I have booked a hotel not far off from our school. The hotel is called the Epsom Down Hotel. Your plane will arrive in England by 9:00. There will be a coach waiting for you, and the driver will be next to the information desk. You should arrive at the hotel by 11:00. You will thanthen have an hour to check in and unpack all your luggage. The conference will start on time at 12:30, so I would suggest you to leaveleave the hotel by 12:00. The best way to get to the conference is to follow along the collagecollege road and turn left toward the end, you. You thanthen keep going straight, you. You will eventually see the main entrance ofto the collagecollege. When you get into the college you can just ask any boys in the college where to go from then. They all knowsknow where the conference is and when.

At the end of the conference, we will have a party. The party is to let all the students to getget to know each other better. The party will be in the dance hall next to the conference room. I willwould suggustsuggest themthey to wearwear formal clothing, as insuch as tie, trousers and blaserblazer.

For the afternoon free time on the last day. There, there are a wide variety of choices in the things that they can do. They can play tennis, do athletics, swimmingswim... and many other sports eventeventsactivities in our school, if they want to. Or they can also visit the Epsom Town. There are shops which salessell clothsclothes, foodsfood, and books ... They can decide what they want to do, it's. It's entirely up to them.
I am looking forward to seeing you and hophope you have a safe flight over to England.

Welcome to Taiwan. This report is based on an interesting building, where you can take, for your students to visit. This building is situated in Taipei, the capital. The building is called the Chiang Kei-shek MomerialMemorial Hall. Nearly everyone knows where this building is, so if you have a chance, just ask the local people in Taipei about this building.

The momerialmemorialMemorial Hall is surrounded by large playgrounds. As you go into the main Hall, you will see a huge statue of Chiang Kei-shek, this. This is because the building is the rememberenceremembrance of how well Chiang did in History. The statue is about 20 feet high. Next to theThe statue is protected by the guards, the. The guards will change every four hours.

Apart from the main Hall, there are also lots of other gallariesgalleries. In these gallariesgalleries there are Historical paintings, and antique furnituresfurniture which Chiang used. These treasuretreasures are very old, even older than the history of America. All these treasures were brought over to Taiwan by Chiang during the defeat in China. They are all beenbeing well looklooked after.

As well as all the treasures, statuestatues and historical paintings...Therethere are also restaurent'srestaurant'srestaurants and modern gallariesgalleries. When you are tired after looking around you might want to buy drinks or something to eat, or if you are fed up with historical thingthings, you mighmight as well just pop into the modern gallery to see things which are more modern.

Finally, if you wentwant to visit this building I willwould recommend you to staystay at a hotel not far from the momerialmemorial Hall called the Hyatt Hotel. It only taketakes about five minutes if you walk. I hope you will all have a great time in Taiwan and I hope you will enjoy the building.
